required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Insulin Peglispro in Healthy Male Japanese Participants
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Dose Study to Evaluate the Pharmacokinetics and Glucodynamics of Insulin Peglispro (LY2605541) in Healthy Male Japanese Subjects

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare
Japan: Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate how the body processes the study drug known as insulin peglispro and how the study drug affects blood sugar in healthy male Japanese participants. This study will also evaluate safety of the study drug. The study will last up to 46 days for each participant, not including screening.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics/Dynamics Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of Insulin Peglispro
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: Predose up to 192 hours postdose

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Area Under the Concentration Curve (AUC) of Insulin Peglispro
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: Predose up to 192 hours postdose
Day1: Predose up to 36 hours post dose

primary_outcome.measure: Glucodynamics: Total Amount of Glucose Infused (Gtot)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day1: Predose up to 36 hours post dose

arm_group.description: Insulin peglispro is given subcutaneously once.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants are overtly healthy male Japanese.
- Participants have Body Mass Index (BMI) between 18.5 and 25.0 kilogram per square meter (kg/m^2), inclusive.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants have known allergies to insulin peglispro, related compounds.
- Participants have a fasting venous blood glucose >108 milligram per deciliter (mg/dL) (>6 millimole per liter [mmol/L]).

facility.name: For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.
